title.narrative: The Children and Youth as Popular Reporters

description.narrative: The continuation project promotes children and youth agency and capacity to increment awareness of their rights through the media. During the previous phase of the project the active citizenship participation of children and youth and their organization in student councils and neighbourhood brigades has been strengthened. Also children youth parents custodians and teachers have been educated in the thematic fields such as: democracy child and youth rights citizen rights and duties prevention of violence and discrimination equality and participation. In the continuation stage the focus will be particularly on strengthening the communication skills and media education of children and youth by learning modules and practical implementation. This way it is possib le to gain an awareness of a greater audience in topics concerning the whole society. The children and youth have participated in the planning of the project. With the project ?popular reporter? education will be provided for 420 children and youth who wil l be able to apply the learned skills also in the future. Communication via the media will be carried out through the production and broadcast of a weekly radio show. The programs will cover topics chosen by the children and youth such as: human rights pre vention of violence equality forms of discrimination different worldviews interculturality etc. Education will be provided for 220 parents custodians leaders and members of neighbourhood associations as well as 120 teachers and headmasters about gender equ ality human rights and intercultural dialogue. The themes and outputs are closely in line with the development policy key areas and cross-sectional goals of Finland and Bolivia. The principal beneficiaries are the children and youth school staff and parent s in the areas 3 and 4 of Oruro city. Many children and youth are from poor immigrant indigenous families. They live in challenging conditions and are at a risk of discrimination and marginalization. The activities of the project promote the accomplishment of citizen rights and reduce inequality. The right to a non-violent life and inviolability of children and youth is a priority.
